website_summaries.verdict: This peppermint oil is strong and has a pleasant scent associated with it along with being easy to use.
pros: After purchase, manufacturer emails user’s guide to each customer
Potent formula and pleasant scent make this an impressive choice
Suitable for use directly on skin
cons: Scent may be too strong to use in a diffuser by itself

customer_reviews.title: A SAFE SPIDER REPULSER THAT GOES A VERY LONG WAY
customer_reviews.text: Got spiders? Here is a simple receipt that keeps them away: In a quart or so size hand sprayer, put 10 drops of peppermint oil, 1/2 ounce of Dawn dishwashing liquid and fill the rest with water. Shake well and spray inside or outside. It is not poisonous, so it does not kill the insect, it just makes them leave. Where it smells nice to humans, bugs hate it. It is cheap and effective, and has other uses too.
customer_reviews.author: JON MEREDITH

customer_reviews.title: Not the best.
customer_reviews.text: I bought 3 different brands.. I loved the others this not so much .. t has cheap /burnt smell to it. Actually I bought this one because a user guide was promised to come with it. I never received it ( yes I checked my Spam folder ) I waited about 3 weeks - 1 month later I contacted the seller asking for it .. Never heard another thing.
customer_reviews.author: Cat

customer_reviews.title: No more mice.
customer_reviews.text: So far I love it. Been using this product for a couple of days now. We have been seeing mice around the house for a few weeks. Been catching them using the sticky traps. Saw this product on here and decided to try it. Since we bought this I have yet to see one mouse. All I did was take 1 cotton ball to each room with a few drops of the oil on it. Worked instantly the first night. Haven’t seen them since. Definitely would recommend over any use of those mouse traps.
customer_reviews.author: trey

customer_reviews.title: Great for driving away mice
customer_reviews.text: Great for driving away mice! I had been hearing mice in my ductwork for about 3 weeks. Must have had a whole family of mice. Had put out several D-Con poison baits, which slowed them down but some were still active. After putting the peppermint oil on some old washcloths and draping over the heat registers, I stopped hearing mice in less than an hour! I am waiting now for an exterminator who will charge me $199 for an inspection and setting some traps. Made the appointment when I got scared I might have a rat. Wish I had tried peppermint oil sooner.
customer_reviews.author: elaine

customer_reviews.title: Extremely bad product
customer_reviews.text: FAKE PRODUCT!!!!!! Please buyers beware of the new peppermint essential oil sold recently. Totally different from the old one. I am a fan of this product and wrote a review about the old one i bought which was good but don't know why the changed the quality this time around. Bought a new one thinking its as effective as the whole one but like 2months after still crappy and lacks the good features of the old one. Please don't buy this unless you intend wasting money. So so fake. Just fake. No no no for me
customer_reviews.author: Uchechukwu E.

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Does not work! Also, it comes with an email to contact the producer who will then send you detailed instructions. Emailed them and never heard back from them. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works, but dont use too much!
customer_reviews.text: Did the trick to bring out the mouse into the trap, however, we put too many drops on the cotton balls around the house and in cabinets and our house smelled like peppermint for a month! So a little goes a long way. Use very little (maybe one or two drops) on the cotton balls, this stuff is very potent. On the flip side, we haven't seen another mouse or big in the house due to the very strong smell!
customer_reviews.author: Mellany

customer_reviews.title: Maybe the product is good but no User Guide
customer_reviews.text: Anxiously awaiting user guide. Maybe the product is good but what a waste, I want to use it now and they have not emailed me a user guide. The email address provided isn’t working. Why not post the user guide in the product pictures or provide a download site with your literature so we don’t have to depend on an email that doesn’t go through?
customer_reviews.author: Lovely Rita

customer_reviews.title: Vehical Rodent control in out building.
customer_reviews.text: Works great, I use it for mouse and rodent control in my Corvette during storage. Take several plastic containers i.e. cool whip containers and put several I/4" wide slits in the lid and soak some cotton balls with a few drops of this oil in them, I put three inside the car and one in the engine compartment and recoat about once a month, Has worked great for me, no signs of infestation. And the car smells great but airs out fast when you get it on the road.
customer_reviews.author: MCP

customer_reviews.title: Not the best brand Peppermint Oil
customer_reviews.text: I peppermint oil as an exterminator to keep mice out of my Brooklyn apt. There is another 3 letter brand that is much, MUCH more fragrant and effective. You can usually smell the oil soaked cotton balls in the hallways of the building. But with this brand I cannot even smell them right after I soak them. Will go back to the other brand.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Adams

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy their so called essential oils, they are NOT pure essential oils as stated. Save your money
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: KateS peppermint oil far exceeded my expectations.
customer_reviews.text: This worked to get rid of rats. I bought this 4 oz bottle 2 years ago and, today (2 yrs later), it still smells as nice and potent as the day I received it. KateS makes fantastic essential oils. I also have the KateS lavender oil, which I didn't like at first (i guess i'm one of the few who don't like the smell of lavender), but it REALLY helped me to get good sleep, so..I use it a lot. I'll be buying more KateS. Next on my list to try is the ylang ylang..
customer_reviews.author: T. Tran

customer_reviews.title: Peppermint oil for mouse deterrent
customer_reviews.text: I got this product as a mouse deterrent, and was not sure how well it would work. The vendor email me which was great with some information and tips. I used rolled up paper towels (cigar shaped) put them in my kitchen, bathroom and in desk. I have experimented with the amount used and finally have that right. I have not had any mice in 5 days! I also used the dapper and put it inside the ceiling insulation in the basement. It has worked so well and very economical, also smells good!!
customer_reviews.author: Ann Golding

customer_reviews.title: FINALLY FOUND SOMETHING THAT WORKS!!
customer_reviews.text: OMG! I finally found something to help me get rid of moles, voles, mice & chipmunks!! I have spent so much money in the past 3 years fighting these little critters!! I did not want to poison them!! When I heard about the uses for peppermint oil, which actually was advertised for getting rid of mice, I figured I would try it in all the holes dug in my yard by various critters! I put peppermint oil on cotton balls and dropped them into the holes... IT WORKED!! They moved out and so far, have not returned!! Thank you for this amazing product!
customer_reviews.author: Penni Vacca

customer_reviews.title: Good Buy
customer_reviews.text: Great quality oil. And the bottle is big enough to last for a while.
customer_reviews.author: letterafter_j

customer_reviews.title: No real scent
customer_reviews.text: With all the raving reviews, I was expecting a working product. But as usual, Amazon assigns reviews to the wrong products. This oil does not last for more than 1 or 2 minutes. I literally have to put my nose into the cotton ball to take the smell. It's a shame, for all that money and zero effectiveness.
customer_reviews.author: Rae C

customer_reviews.title: Smells good but hasn't helped with rodent problem!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to help deter field mice from our garage. I love how quickly the eManual arrived! Love the smell and neighbors comment how yummy it makes the garage smell. I used the method of soaking cotton balls. This method only lasts about 7-10days. 10days is a major stretch and we've continued to get mice but the garage smells yummy and it conceals the smell of the nasty sticky pads. The manual clearly states it's not a guaranteed method for rodents but it's been worth the try.
customer_reviews.author: KJ

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I heard that peppermint oil is good to get rid of migraines so I decided to give it a try, now everytime I get a migraine I put a bit of peppermint oil on my temples and most of the time I don't even have to take any painkillers! I also use it when I get a cold, I put a few drops of it in some boiling water and I inhale the steam, it gets rid of my stuffy nose.
customer_reviews.author: Aurora B.

customer_reviews.title: This oil sucks !
customer_reviews.text: I bought this oil because of its rave reviews on Amazon and the user guide. I was so disappointed with this oil. When I opened the bottle, the peppermint scent was very weak. On top of that, I never got any user guide from them. What a waste of money and the oil isn’t cheap too.
customer_reviews.author: MCA

customer_reviews.title: Good rodent deterant
customer_reviews.text: This actually seems to work when used as recommended. Rodents (mice) had found their way into the garage last year and I wasn't keen on the traditional bait mostly because I didn't want to "hunt" for the dead carcass when it started to smell. Punched holes in two small containers and saturated the cotton balls. A month later the feces and urine stopped. Re-saturate the cotton balls every 4-6 weeks and nothing for the last year. I do wish there was a better way to dispense. The dropper is tedious and pouring directly from the bottle can be messy.
customer_reviews.author: GSXR

customer_reviews.title: Mint has worked to drive mice and rats out of ...
customer_reviews.text: Mint has worked to drive mice and rats out of my car and out of the garage. Thinking mice and critters will get used to the smell if I overuse it. Thus, it is only applied a few times per year if there is no sign of ants or rodents trying to share my space. Applying a dilute (one oz per gallon) mixture to the concrete above the soil around the house has apparently deterred ants and insects as well. Careful not to apply too heavily since insects acclimate to poisons even eventually.
customer_reviews.author: RJ

customer_reviews.title: KEEPS MICE OUT
customer_reviews.text: Great for keeping mice out of the house. Just spray diluted oil around suspected entry points in basement.
customer_reviews.author: Marine

customer_reviews.title: Great quality oil
customer_reviews.text: I've been using the peppermint oil to keep rodents away from my car engine and so far so good. I've spent over $500 to repair chewed wires and this oil is as pure as it gets. I have received compliments on the pleasant scent. Just don't over do it 🤢 . Recently purchased a less expensive brand that claimed to be pure but a major difference. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Mardi T

customer_reviews.title: Nice without overpowering...
customer_reviews.text: Peppermint Oil was received in a very timely manner; packaging was exactly as needed without being over-packaged. I am enjoying the scent in my house. I put a small cotton ball with a little oil in several rooms and so far only a hint of a scent. Exactly what I wanted - not overpowering. I recently moved into this 1930's bungalow and understand there may be critter issues down the line (area around the bungalow is wooded). I will be using this oil as a critter deterrent - nice that it has a very pleasant scent as an added bonus. I do recommend this oil and this seller.
customer_reviews.author: mtndiva

customer_reviews.title: We were having a problem with mice getting in house ...
customer_reviews.text: We were having a problem with mice getting in house. Saw this online as a remedy for getting rid of the pest. It took a couple weeks of putting drops on cotton balls around area where mice seemed to be. After a while we saw no more mice. But my husband keeps putting drops on cotton balls about every week or so. This did seem to work.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Krajec

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: The box it came in was super beat up, but luckily the packager protected the product very well and it arrived in damaged. It has a normal twist off lid that you can replace with a glass eyedropper (provided) and the bottle itself is glass, and huge for an oil. The design of the packaging is also very pleasing. Considering the price as well, I am very impressed for the quality of the oil as well as the size- it’s extremely potent and rivals my much smaller peppermint essential oil. All in all, a high quality product that I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Luka

customer_reviews.title: Professionally packaged.  Quality product
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with my purchase. We just moved to a 2200ft elevation next to the National Forest. Lovely as that is with privacy and a creek there are plenty of invaders called mice. We caught 7 the first night we put out glue traps. Then 2 babies and a mama or dad came in. I read peppermint keeps them out. So far so good. Fingers crossed.
customer_reviews.author: Sue E. Ramsey

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT smell like peppermint
customer_reviews.text: I use an unflavored toothpaste, but I prefer mint, so for probably five years now I have been putting a drop of peppermint oil on my toothbrush and rinsing most of it off before applying the toothpaste. I should have stuck with the Now brand I was using. This stuff is disgusting. It smells and tastes like dirt, or like it's mixed with tea tree oil, which I abhor. I would rather use the toothpaste unflavored than feel like I licked dirt. I have a huge 4 oz bottle of this stuff to get rid of now. I ordered a few months ago, so I can't return it. What a waste.
customer_reviews.author: LC, mom to four sons

customer_reviews.title: I put drops of this on cotton balls in my ...
customer_reviews.text: I put drops of this on cotton balls in my kitchen cabinets and drawers. I had tried all kinds of mice/rat poisons and they was still evidence of them in the kitchen. They chewed wires in my husband's truck. We found this and put it on cotton balls in the kitchen, under the hood of the truck and on our riding lawn mower. So far, no more mice!
customer_reviews.author: Patricia J Ainsworth

customer_reviews.title: Smells great....
customer_reviews.text: The product is in a glass bottle and a glass eye dropper but it comes very well packed. I can't state on versatility or durability because I just received it. Note that the manual on how to use it is E book ONLY. I did not notice that till afterwards and have not received it yet but it's online only. Be aware the star rating of 3 is only due to the fact that I haven't used it yet but they did come packaged nicely so I had to give it something.
customer_reviews.author: Brian C.

customer_reviews.title: It really works
customer_reviews.text: Reason I've used Kate s peppermint mint oil is to repel mice from my home and it has done just that. Easy to use. I certainly recommend this product. My daughter finds it also helps rid spiders as well.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Custom  Mary Grace

customer_reviews.title: Great essential oil (but mice seem to like it also).
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in hopes of dissuading mice from trying to sneak into my house, but it didn't seem to work on my clan of rodents. Maybe that is a genetic thing, depending on the strain of mice. But it did leave my house with a very pleasant and clean odor. And actually seemed to help keep my sinuses open, when I dabbed a little on my bed pillows. I also put a drop or two on my shirt sleeves by my shoulders. I recommend it for the smell. This bottle seems to be a good value, when I compared it to several others offered on the Amazon site. A little goes a very long way.
customer_reviews.author: P. Hendrick

customer_reviews.title: Got this to get rid of rodents in my outside laundry area.
customer_reviews.text: The pesky critters decided that the drawers under my washer and dryer were a nice home! They chewed everything plastic in there, including the bottle of detergent, which got all over everything. I cleaned up everything and put a nice layer of peppermint oil on the bottom floor of the drawers, as well as the sides. I also put cotton balls soaked with the stuff in the corners. Oh, wow. I love the smell!! I don't know if it will keep the critters away, but geez... my washer/dryer cabinet sure smells good!
customer_reviews.author: SnafoooTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Does not work. Mice just laughed and pooped on the cotton balls with the oil. Lol.
customer_reviews.author: Jose R Reyes

customer_reviews.title: Peppermint Oil Gets Rid Of Mice
customer_reviews.text: Mice (and other rodents) don't like the smell of peppermint oil. I put a few cotton balls inside a plastic yogurt container and add about eights drops of oil. I place this where I find mouse droppings. The product conveniently comes with a solid top and an eyedropper top. While I never see the mice, droppings no longer accumulate--success!!!
customer_reviews.author: Arnie W.

customer_reviews.title: Also gives a nice fresh smell of peppermint
customer_reviews.text: Arrived safe and within two days .... I am using it now for mouse control and seems to be working.... put the peppermint oil on cotton cosmetic pad/or ball using the handy eyedropper. Also gives a nice fresh smell of peppermint ...
customer_reviews.author: Barb B.

customer_reviews.title: Very responsive, easy to use, the book helps and smells like peppermint
customer_reviews.text: As soon as I purchased the product I got an email from the seller with the “recipe” book . Also, received the package in a very timely manner. When the package arrived , the dropper was broke so I contacted the seller and she responded immediately and is sending out a new one ! The smell is strong and I am hoping it will work for my needs ! I am a first time user so I am experimenting!
customer_reviews.author: Thump

customer_reviews.title: Repeals mice
customer_reviews.text: The glass bottle come with a dropper and its very intense, a few drops are enough to cause a fmgreat aroma. I purchased this oil because my garden has been invaded by mice and didnt want to use anything toxic repellanta near my pets. This really works, I mixed about 5 drops in a spray bottle filled with water, I spray every three days all over the garden and even inside my home. The house and garden smell aswesome and even noticed less mosquitos and other bugs nearby.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I bought to use for repelling mice. I soaked cotton balls like others have described and put in the closet where the mouse has been. That was a few days ago and I am pretty sure it has not come back yet. Hopefully this will continue to work until I have a chance to fix the hole. The product is great and I really appreciate the information about peppermint oil and it's uses that is sent to your email.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda K

customer_reviews.title: great stuff
customer_reviews.text: good for keeping the bees and wasps at bay just spray it on them and they are gone love it it . very strong so be care spilled a little goes a long way house smelled peppermint for a while but a nice smell i love it does the trick would buy again
customer_reviews.author: TERRY WOLF

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I am studying essential oils and their uses. I use a lot of peppermint oil for many different things, like cleaning, sinuses, spraying my bathtub, in the laundry, on the carpet and beds. This oil is great for those uses with a little Frankincense. It is definitely not to be used in making cold and flu medicine. So, you have to know what types of oils you are using for the projects you are doing.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Mice hate it !!
customer_reviews.text: Use as a spray to keep mice out of car ventilation system. Also use in shed on lawn tractor motor where they like to build nests. Seems to work well. The only drawback is that it only works for 1-2 weeks then everything has to be re-sprayed. It is non-toxic so I've sprayed around back of counter tops to repel red ants. The verdict is still out on whether it is successful. Smells nice.
customer_reviews.author: Telephone Jack

customer_reviews.title: Great Peppermint oil!
customer_reviews.text: Love this company. I will definitely be buying more essential oils from them.
customer_reviews.author: SWENCILER

customer_reviews.title: extremely bad quality, i was sneezing and got a headache
customer_reviews.text: extremely bad quality, i was sneezing and got a headache, also in less than 5 min the aroma was gone. never had that experience with peppermint e oil i have been using it for 8 years. will never buy this product and not recommend it, waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: customer -x1

customer_reviews.title: Smells nice.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product to deter little critters. I put 7 - 8 large cotton balls soaked with this peppermint oil in my garden shed. It is supposed to deter mice. When I went into the shed maybe 6 weeks later, the cotton balls were gone. I can only assume that the mice are now living in luxury condos! Moral of this story; You have to keep soaking the material that you use or the smell goes away. So I made a spray from it and use it inside my home. Smells nice.
customer_reviews.author: ethel

customer_reviews.title: Best Mouse Control
customer_reviews.text: Have tried them all and the peppermint oil is the only one that works and it works extremely well. I saturated cotton balls and put them where I found mouse droppings including the bread drawer. After several days and now several weeks NO MOUSE evidence at all. I still renew the oil periodically but so far so good. Highly recommend the product.
customer_reviews.author: brer rabbit

customer_reviews.title: Squirrels don’t like it
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this product along with a pressurized dispenser (like the type used by exterminators) due to the squirrel who decided my attic was the ideal place to live. I sprayed the attic & the hole he made under the gutter that he then used to get in & out. Poor bastard kept running up the tree branch, to the roof, and back onto the tree branch for hours. But he hasn’t been inside for 3 days. That’s great cause I didn’t want to kill it, just evict it. This peppermint oil did the trick. Am so glad I ordered it.
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to deter spiders and other insects from my apartment. So far, if I've seen one, I spray the vents, window seals, door frames, and other tight spaces between appliances. Spiders definitely at least stay out of sight. I spray once and it's weeks before I potentially see another one. It's great, since it doesn't smell like pesticides, but it is a rather strong smell for a short time after spraying.
customer_reviews.author: Nichole

customer_reviews.title: Repels Mice
customer_reviews.text: When I read that mice are repelled by smell of peppermint oil...got this product. I soaked 4-5 cotton balls with the oil in in a plastic container. Placed container by the hot water heater...really works. Did not hear mice in the walls. Need to refresh cotton balls every approximately every 1-2 months. Smells nice to humans but not so much to mice and other rodents. Comes with brochure describing many uses of peppermint oil.
customer_reviews.author: DJ400

customer_reviews.title: smells really good but does not do much to repel mice
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use as mice repellent. It arrived on time, smells really good but does not do much to repel mice. We placed cotton balls that had couple of drops of pepper mint oil at places where we saw the mice activity. It helped for a day but then it became in effective even when I used the new cotton balls.
customer_reviews.author: tnv

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for cat repellent
customer_reviews.text: I have a lot of stray cats around the keep taking a dump and puking in my yard, so have been experimenting with different things to keep them away, this didn't work, sure it's probably fine for whatever it's intended for but it didn't work for keeping cats out of my yard. Cayenne pepper mixed with some soap water in a sprayer works, I still mix some of this in there though and it might help I don't know, but it keeps them out for a week or so.
customer_reviews.author: R

customer_reviews.title: Good for spider and bug repellent!
customer_reviews.text: Works great as a spider and bug repellent. I put a few drops on cotton balls and then scatter them around. We live in a basement apartment and had big spiders for room mates. Not anymore! This comes with a glass eye dropper and complete instructions on what you can use peppermint oil for. Very informative!
customer_reviews.author: Sheila polhemus

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money!!!!!😞😭!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This peppermint oil doesn't really smell like peppermint at all. There is a very small hint of peppermint even in the diffuser it's very weak...NOT HAPPY @ ALL!!!!!😞!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Zo😒

customer_reviews.title: A lot for a little.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this essentially to use out in my Bee shed to ward off mice because They dislike peppermint or so I have read. I am hoping that this is the natural remedy that I need to keep them out of my bee boxes in storage. I really appreciate the fact that the company emailed me the booklet of other uses. being able to download that and keep it handy in a file makes all the difference. It is easy to find when I need it and at my fingertips. Looking it over, I did not know that there were so many uses for peppermint oil.
customer_reviews.author: Beemama

customer_reviews.title: Keeps the Rodents Away
customer_reviews.text: This product does works. Due to extensive construction in my building I started having problems with mice. I use the product and over the first three weeks, I only saw one mouse. It does require a little work but it beats the glue traps. The only problem and I also saw this on other reviewers you have to call for the E-book Guide. It does not come with the product.
customer_reviews.author: TravelLady

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: Will not buy again. Not very fragrant and there is definitely a secondary aroma which hints at a plastic storage vessel. Oil is sourced from India. This is not a deal breaker but if it is being stored too long, there is an opportunity for other compounds to make their way into the oil. Not sure if I will continue to us it. More irritating than anything. Certainly counter to its purpose.
customer_reviews.author: GoBlueGirl

customer_reviews.title: I thank her for the great service she offers
customer_reviews.text: I have bought this item from KateS more than once and will keep looking for her to make my purchase. It ia always a pleasant experience dealing with her and I get what I need quickly. I thank her for the great service she offers. Bill
customer_reviews.author: William C. Balzano

customer_reviews.title: Works fabulous
customer_reviews.text: I went for this specific brand because it said it came with a user guide for repelling mice. I have had an issue with mice in the past so I thought maybe down the line it may come in handy but I mainly bought the peppermint for my diffuser. The user guide was emailed right away or within a few hours. The next day a bunch of ants decided to show up in my kitchen and my user guide came in handy because there’s a section on repelling ants! I now use my peppermint spray all the time and the ants have stayed away. I love it and will buy essential oils from this brand again
customer_reviews.author: LC

customer_reviews.title: Deter those squirrels
customer_reviews.text: I use this in my garbage can. Squirrels have eaten through the hard rubber can to get to garbage and make a mess. My daughter refers to them as "extreme squirrels ".🙂 I have not had a problem since using the peppermint oil in the can. I am looking forward to using some of the other applications that were shown in the PDF file I received.
customer_reviews.author: mr ed

customer_reviews.title: Keeps the Aedes Mosquitos away
customer_reviews.text: Just a little rubbed on exposed skin keeps the Aedes Mosquitos away from me. The peppermint smell subsides quickly so I am not walking around smelling like a peppermint patty and still keeps the buggers away from me. If you are in southern california and are getting eaten alive by the Aedes Mosquito, now in our second season, try using peppermint extract instead of chemical sprays.
customer_reviews.author: BoomBoom

customer_reviews.title: This stuff is cool. It smells good and keeps the rats at ...
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is cool. It smells good and keeps the rats at bay. When the weather warms a bit here the rodents tend to stop by and take up residence in our out door storage room. I was using glue traps but those tend to catch everything. The I read about mothballs, those work great but smell like .....like mothballs and the smell permeates everything in the room. Then I found out about this stuff and gave it a try. So far so good and the seller sent some really good instructions. Would by this again and recommend for pest control.
customer_reviews.author: jondoe

customer_reviews.title: A little off smelling, but does the trick!
customer_reviews.text: This isn't the same peppermint scent that I'm used to (smells a little more bitter [if that makes sense]), but it serves its purpose. The wasps are staying away! Update 6/8/2020: bought another peppermint essential oil at a local store, which proved that this one was rancid when received.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: the price was the best value for this size bottle
customer_reviews.text: This bottle was the size I was looking for, the price was the best value for this size bottle. This is a very good quality peppermint essential oil. I plan to use it to keep the mice from coming in my Ohana but after reading the booklet I want to use it with my cleaning especiLly the baseboards and counter tops. The bottle came right on the day I was told it would. It was well packed and a dropped was included and securely wrapped to prevent any breakage. I am very please with my purchase and this provider.
customer_reviews.author: Reatha

customer_reviews.title: Bought for getting rid of rats or whatever was in my chimney
customer_reviews.text: I read from others that this scent works to get rid of rats, mice and other critters. I put a piece of wood in my fireplace to drop the scent on so it wouldn't get all over my fireplace and I have to say, whatever was in my chimney flue is no longer there! The scent wafted up as planned! So yeah, I guess you could say it works for that. I am happy. I like the smell also.
customer_reviews.author: kglcmr

customer_reviews.title: Spiders
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product for a spider problem. Prefer to use something that is not toxic. Followed directions and sprayed entire house but still see spiders. Using stcky paper to catch. Freaked out when found a spider on my pillow. Not sure this is helping.
customer_reviews.author: Pumpkin48

customer_reviews.title: It’s a Winner!
customer_reviews.text: I like Peppermint Essential Oil because it is invigorating in the morning & it acts as an expectorant, helping to open my airways, clear mucus and reduce congestion, it helps boost my energy levels on road trips, at work or any other time I need a pick me up! I also like putting 3 drops each of peppermint, eucalyptus, & lavender oils in my diffuser at night as it helps me fall asleep.
customer_reviews.author: Glo

customer_reviews.title: Make sure to re-apply every few months
customer_reviews.text: This product is being used in our RV. Our Trailer is stored in an area with lots of critters. Mice, spiders, bugs ext.... We bought cotton balls and soaked them with this product. Although we had some spider webs outside of the trailer. We had no signs of spiders or rodents inside. This stuff really works well.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Brown

customer_reviews.title: Seams like what I wanted!
customer_reviews.text: Smell like the real stuff and I love the glass eye dropper. The bottle looks like an old classic. I’ll be repelling spiders from my mountain home with a teaspoon or so of this very strong pure oil.
customer_reviews.author: Randall Mooney

customer_reviews.title: Not super strong
customer_reviews.text: I use this for my diffuser. I’ve had to use a lot because the scent isn’t strong or lasting but if you just smell it from the bottle or rub a few drops in your hand it’s definitely stronger but still wears off quickly . I bought this one because the one I usually buy was out of stock but I do like the scent, reminds me of peppermint candy!
customer_reviews.author: Jessie

customer_reviews.title: Strong
customer_reviews.text: Very extremely powerful good good good helps keep mice and ants away so don't have to use poisons and pesticides. We've been using this for years now. Used to have more problems with ants in house and mice in car eating wires. Since used this haven't had so much problems. I usually buy 4 of these and put them in a spray bottle that I also got on amazon and spray around the front under the car, and near the windows. That way they ants and mice can't smell the pheromones or whatever that they use to follow the other ants and mice.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Did Not Work on Mice
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews and got this product to get rid of mice in my basement. I put the drops of oil on the cotton balls and put the containers in different corners of the basement. I put more oil every day. The smell was good but the mice were there. One week later, I have to get to other means to get rid of the mice. Do not buy for mice. May be it does not work on New York mice!
customer_reviews.author: Naeem Ahmad

customer_reviews.title: Great Scent/Great Service
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love the Peppermint oil. I purchased it as an air freshener. It also helps with my sinus problems. When friends enter my work space they are sure I just finished cleaning. It's the fresh sent of the peppermint oil. I initially purchased it to keep the squirrels out of my perennials but there are many other uses. Thank you Kate for responding so quickly to my email questions. Great product and TOPS for the customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Miteddy1

customer_reviews.title: Mice-be-gone!
customer_reviews.text: We travel and sometimes we're away. An empty house in the middle of a forest is a mice-magnet! Every time we leave I dilute this, put some on a paper towel and place it over each air/heat register and voila, no mice when we're back! (and yes, there was a problem one time to cause me to look into deterents.
customer_reviews.author: Starlight

customer_reviews.title: Love the Peppermint Essential Oil
customer_reviews.text: Love the Peppermint Essential Oil. My main purpose for buying it was to control rats getting into the engine bay of my RV. But found out through their manual that there are lots of other beneficial uses. I put a few drops on a 4" paint roller and put two of these in my engine bay. Love the smell and no longer any signs of rodents. Also we winter in southern AZ and they have problems with pack rats so I will take it with me. Definitely recommend this products for all their uses. Great support from the Essentially Kates.
customer_reviews.author: G.  Kevin Hannah

customer_reviews.title: Love the smell
customer_reviews.text: Package arrived on time and in great shape. Seller took care to wrap everything so nothing leaked or was broken. She sent a nice E booklet with different ways to use the Peppermint oil. I tried it in my waterpik and it worked great and it worked great and made my mouth feel great. Good seller.
customer_reviews.author: Linda M

customer_reviews.title: Where's the Peppermint Smell?
customer_reviews.text: I was really wishing to receive what I paid for, unfortunately I received peppermint oil with an extremely light barely noticeable smell. It baffles me beyond my understanding of how this product received 4 stars. Highly disappointed! Complete waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Smells nice and keeps away insects
customer_reviews.text: I've never used essential oils before, so have no baseline to compare this to, but it worked very well for me. I used this to make a spray to keep insects off of my kitchen countertops! It works well for insects (I have not seen any ants since I got this!). I've found that to repel mice, it needs to be reapplied every couple days. I also used this as part of an insect-repellant spray for my garden plants.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Smells great, many uses
customer_reviews.text: I put a few drops of this oil in my garbage disposal drain to make it smell fresh. I also put a few drops in my garbage can and it works great. I set a small dish of this oil on my counter as I was having issues with boxelder bugs getting in the house and I haven't seen one since. A little goes a long way, this is my second bottle, the first lasted about 18 months. It's good stuff!
customer_reviews.author: Babs A

customer_reviews.title: Small bottle but very strong. Would probably work for mice in smaller areas
customer_reviews.text: Got for sudden mouse issues. They didn’t go in the area we saw them when we placed this there. But that just made them go someplace else. Had to buy poison I didn’t want to do bc empty abandon house next door had infestation. But peppermint did keep them from the closet area we put this
customer_reviews.author: Bomb

customer_reviews.title: Essentially KateS Peppermint Oil
customer_reviews.text: I love this peppermint oil. It is such a great price for a 4 oz bottle also. I use peppermint oil often as I found the scent of it helps my migraine headaches. It also gives me relief from my muscle aches and pains. I mix it and put into spray bottles and lotions and found out that while it helps my headaches and muscle pain, it also keeps mosquitoes away. I was at a luau party where everyone got bit but me. Much better than chemical sprays and smells better too!! I also use it with my oil diffuser mixed with water to scent my home. Very nice seller. I will order Lavender oil next.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda C

customer_reviews.title: Works against mice and beats moth ball smell
customer_reviews.text: I have to admit that this stuff works for my purpose to keep rodents away. I live on wooded acreage the country where mice are a problem for things that are stored outside. I've been putting this peppermint extract onto cotton balls that I place in small plastic bags that I poke holes in. I put 6 of these bags inside my snowmobile trailer in the summer and 6 inside my boat in the fall/winter. I hated the smell if the alternatives like moth balls but like the peppermint smell. It works like a charm to keep them away!
customer_reviews.author: RydeAway

customer_reviews.title: Did not keep away chipmunks or rabbits
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to keep away chipmunks and rabbits. Did not work at all. So I used the rest for oil scent in the house. Smells great.
customer_reviews.author: Spenux

customer_reviews.title: Great scent!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to help with our rodent problem. While it did not get rid of our mice it may have deterred them, I’m not sure. This stuff is super potent though, every time I opened our pantry the fresh peppermint smell hit me. I’m thinking I’ll just keep the cotton balls in there just because I like the scent.
customer_reviews.author: Tomorrah H Stallings

customer_reviews.title: Nice!
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I was looking for. Used it on some dryer sheets and put them in the attic. No rodent problems at all.
customer_reviews.author: J black

customer_reviews.title: Terrific Product & Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: First it cleared my sinuses, then it worked great to keep ants out of our butterfly enclosure. I soaked couple cotton balls & placed on the outside of the enclosure where ants were coming in. This worked for about a week before ants started coming in again at a different point. I just refreshed the oil on the cotton balls & moved them to the new access point & all ants gone within prox an hour. Can't wait to try on mice & on aphids in diluted spray. Info provided to customers is thorough & complete. One of my best experiences buying online.
customer_reviews.author: Carsig

customer_reviews.title: Impressed with quality
customer_reviews.text: High quality oil makes all the difference. Strength is perfect and comes with email and guide showing all possible uses. Includes a coupon for a future order also. Price is right and really no-risk. Go for it.
customer_reviews.author: thekingdom

customer_reviews.title: Dropper sucks but the oil is perfect
customer_reviews.text: The dropper is most ineffective, but the oil most definitely is not. It's definitively peppermint oil, though it seems some people believe otherwise in the reviews, and has helped ward off insects in my garden. It smells great and is a decent price at $17 for 4 oz. As far as why the dropper doesn't really work, fully submerged in the oil, having squeezed the rubber base in preparation for extraction, the most it'll get and then try to hold (i.e. drip out if you're not careful) is a quarter of the size of the dropper. It's not terribly precise, but you just have to be careful (and only do a bit at a time).
customer_reviews.author: B. Ellison

customer_reviews.title: I haven't seen that but I know it's Great to kill any doggie orders it's very strong but ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm not saying it gets rid of mice, I haven't seen that but I know it's Great to kill any doggie orders it's very strong but so pleasent every time I have company they say oh it's smells so good in here, so sweet and clean so I will be ordering it again I will repost a second comment on the mice update....so I'm saving the last two 🌟
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Natural Pest Repellant
customer_reviews.text: Using peppermint oil as a natural pest repellent against ants, aphids, cockroaches, flies, mosquitos and mice!! I have dogs and don't want to use products they may want to digest. This works very well. Gave 2 away to my children for their homes. Also, received $1 off for next Kate oil product. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Grateful Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Great product for keeping mice at bay!!!
customer_reviews.text: This product is great and I will order it again when I have used it up!!! NO MORE MICE!!!! and my pantry smells so-o-o-ooo good! Update: I have just received my second bottle of this great peppermint oil. The mice still hate it and I haven't seen any signs of them since I started using this peppermint oil last summer. Plus, my kitchen and pantry always smell nice and fresh.
customer_reviews.author: ALP

customer_reviews.title: Don’t make the same mistake
customer_reviews.text: This was absolutely horrible!!! I am very disappointed. It smells like broke down oil, it is not as effective as other peppermint oils purchased. I only tried this since my favorite company stopped making peppermint oil but this keeps an oil smell that drowns out the peppermint. Even when this oil is cut it breaks my skin out. Very dissatisfied and what a waste if money!!
customer_reviews.author: Perrethia

customer_reviews.title: Good product.
customer_reviews.text: I liked the fact the bottle was glass and the dropper was glass.. However it was faulty. When I drew up the liquid it would just pour out rather than allow me to make droplets. Possibly the rubber topper was not as fitted as tightly as it should have been. The scent didn't last as long as I would have liked. I expected it to be more concentrated than it was.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Peppermint Oil keeps Mosquitoes away
customer_reviews.text: I love this Peppermint oil. I have some kind of chemicals in my body that the mosquitoes just love, A good friend said try Peppermint Oil, I looked at her like she was crazy but i decided to go ahead and order. WOW GOD it really works and I know longer attract those nasty biting mosquitoes. Thank you so much. You saved my life. Now I enjoy going camping.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda Delaney

customer_reviews.title: Sweet smell of peppermint
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful product and definitely 100% pure peppermint oil. Works great for sweeping away odors. I put a couple of drops on a few cotton balls in my bathroom and immediately the room was full of peppermint. It only takes a few drops so use it sparingly. I'm told that peppermint oil is good for a variety of uses but I've only used it for deodorizing. It does the job well and at a great price. I totally recommend this product and especially this seller!
customer_reviews.author: nanashobby

customer_reviews.title: Good for unwanted critters.
customer_reviews.text: Been using Peppermint oil for years in my hunting camp RV parked in the woods. Put on a cotton ball, place in obvious places for mice. Best remedy I've found. This particular brand is very concentrated and you get a great value for you money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Strong stuff
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to battle ants in my kitchen so right away you know I'm not really "into" essential oils. I learned several things: #1. four ounces is a LOT! #2. Peppermint oil smells STRONGLY of peppermint! and #3 the aroma, while pleasant, deterred me more than the ants. Anybody need some peppermint oil?
customer_reviews.author: Ciobair

customer_reviews.title: Great smell
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used it yet but smelled it and seems to be good. I'm going to be using it for my ant problem. I will be putting it into a spray bottle and maybe diluting a little to spray for the ants. I purchased peppermint oil from my local grocer for the ants and it worked pretty good. I wished they made this bottle in a larger size.
customer_reviews.author: C. Davis

customer_reviews.title: nothing less than awesome Also, I rubbed a few drops on my ...
customer_reviews.text: Well, the oil works on everything! I sprayed 8 days ago and whether it is a “coincidence” or a miracle, don’t know but the first morning, there was nothing, again the second morning. Then I left for the city returning 3 days later and found nothing to vacuum. For the past several years, I've had a serious infestation of Asian lady beetles all year long: 1,000s of them. I was vacuuming daily. No lady beetles or any other insect present in my home, nothing less than awesome Also, I rubbed a few drops on my arms, neck and legs while I mowed the lawn; no annoying bugs around me :-) THANK YOU :-)
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Feig

customer_reviews.title: Worked Flawlessly
customer_reviews.text: I used this as a rodent deterrent in my home. Within 5min of putting it down the mice became very uneasy. They left! In no way am I saying it will work that way for you but I am saying it worked perfectly for the reason I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: TaiP

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this oil.  Has worked well for my needs.
customer_reviews.text: I'm big on essential oils. This has a very good consistency, and a lovely peppermint smell. Has worked well for my needs. Still in love with this oil. My new bottle just arrived and I LOVE that there is an expiration date on the box. I've been using this to help ward off mosquitoes, it works pretty well. Can't say it stops every bug from biting me, but I'm a walking buffett to bugs. If there is one within miles it finds me and bites me. Applying small amounts to my legs, arms and neck has drastically cut down the number of bits. It also works well to lower swelling.
customer_reviews.author: K.Stanford

product_meta.title: Peppermint Essential Oil 4 oz. with Detailed User's Guide E-Book and Glass Dropper by Essentially KateS.
product_meta.description:
Peppermint oil may be the most useful and versatile of all essential oils.

Uses abound in the house, kitchen, and garden. The highest quality peppermint oils come from East India, where warm days, cool nights, and plentiful rainfall yield the perfect balance of nature that produce the best peppermint oils. This is the origin of Essentially KateS Premium Peppermint Oil. When you buy Essentially KateS, you're not just getting a Premium Essential Oil. You'll also receive outstanding product support and customer service.

At Essentially KateS, the most important part of what we do doesn't end, but begins with the sale. Your complete and continued satisfaction is our top priority. 

You'll also receive our very detailed Usage Guide, which is based on actual scientific research into the benefits of peppermint oil. 
Please note that the guide is provided only in the form of a pdf file sent by e-mail attachment when your order ships. It is sometimes blocked by e-mail servers, so if you don't receive it, please contact us to have it resent. 

In addition, we'll soon be adding more essential oils, always working to bring you the best essential oils available. 

Finally, if you're EVER unhappy with Essentially KateS Premium Peppermint Oil, simply return it for a complete refund, no questions asked. So what are you waiting for? Order now so that we can get your Premium Peppermint Oil on it's way! And how about a second bottle as the perfect gift for a special friend!
feature_bullets: Each bottle comes with a long glass dropper, and our detailed User's Guide, sent by e-mail attachment when your peppermint oil ships, as an E-book. If for any reason you don't receive the guide, just send an e-mail to the address on the bottle.
Peppermint oil has many uses, in the house, yard, and garden. Simple how-to instructions are included in the User's Guide.
Peppermint oil is an excellent natural all purpose cleaner to help keep your home and kitchen clean, and smelling fresh.
If you are unhappy with our product for any reason, we will provide a full refund or replacement, at your request. No explanation necessary. Your satisfaction is our highest priority.
Due to the fact that there is no available certification as "food grade" for essential oils, all of our oils are labeled as not for internal use.
